summary: Falkreath Hunting Cabin is a lore friendly, free player home that's available to all players at any point in the game. Perfect for those who want a simple, yet beautiful, player home.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/6tR8EgB.png[/img]
Falkreath Hunting Cabin is a lore friendly, free player home that's available to all players at any point in the game. Ideal for any hunter/archer character, and perfect for those who want a simple, yet beautiful, player home.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/sz2IvKv.png[/img]
- Updated Skyrim (Version 1.9.32.0.8)
- Hearthfire (No Hearthfire version also available)


[img]http://i.imgur.com/L3HtzxN.png[/img]
[b]Version 1.0.4[/b]
- Fixed the dust beams not altering their intensity based on the time of day
Note: If you're updating from 1.0.4 or earlier, the same update rules as v1.1.0 still apply; remove all items from chests and other storages, fast travel away and save, uninstall your current version and then install the new one. These rules dont apply to updating from v1.1.0 to this version (v1.1.1).

[b]Version 1.1.0[/b]
- Added a small garden outside (Requires Hearthfire, no Hearthfire/garden edition still available however) - [b]BEFORE UPDATING FROM v1.0.4 OR EARLIER, REMOVE ALL ITEMS FROM ANY CONTAINERS AND FAST TRAVEL AWAY, OR ELSE ALL ITEMS WILL BE LOST. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.[/b]
- Added an NMM Installer to choose between the two versions (Heartfire or Vanilla)

[b]Version 1.0.4[/b]
- Added an anvil and workbench
* Fixed very minor lighting issue

[b]Version 1.0.3[/b]
* Fixed exterior terrain texture issue under the cage

[b]Version 1.0.2[/b]
* Fixed the 'Pelt and Meat' and the 'Fish' Barrels respawning - [b]REMOVE CONTENTS BEFORE UPDATING TO ELIMINATE ANY RISK OF LOSING CONTENTS[/b]

[b]Version 1.0.1[/b]
Bug fixes:
* Fixed navmesh ( followers can now enter the house without a problem)
* Fixed owning problem that stopped the player using the bed
* Fixed chair positioning that caused the player to clip into the table
* Fixed floating bedroll
* Fixed floating rabbit on meat table

[b]Version 1.0.0[/b]
- Initial release


[img]http://i.imgur.com/c5yv8ru.png[/img]
Couldn't be simpler, just walk up to it and open the door!


[img]http://i.imgur.com/5iy6PMt.png[/img]
- A new player home on the edge of Falkreath (see the images tab for a map)

- Plenty of (safe) storage

- Plenty of ingredients surrounding the house

- Wood Chopping Block with Axe

- Cooking Pot

- Alchemy station

- Tanning Rack

- Grindstone

- A new bow (Huntman's Bow) with 100 Steel Arrows

- Archery Skill Book inside the house

- Plus much more!


[img]http://i.imgur.com/f55YAtC.png[/img]
Either:

- Use NMM (or another mod manager) RECOMMENDED

- Manual install (drag and drop .esp and .bsa into your Skyrim Data folder)

- Position in load order should not be problem, but you should run BOSS out of a matter of course regardless.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/BC4LBz6.png[/img]
Resources:
- Tueffel - Various Resources
- Oaristys & Tony67 - Modder's Resource Pack
author: Jordan
